intro: Lagochilium igneum, commonly known as the flame calyx, is a striking flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant red-orange bracts that surround its small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other showy flowering plants like willows and evening primroses. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive. The botanical features of Lagochilium igneum make it both visually appealing and ecologically significant in its native habitat.
